contentencoded: Lobster prices have been shockingly low this summer -- $2.20/pound dockside. Climate change is a key reason given, but what's going on with shrimp? The price is through the roof. Marketplace's Adriene Hill joins Morning Report host David Brancaccio to explain. Click on the audio player above to hear more.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, September 2, 2013

teaser: Lobster prices have been shockingly low this summer -- $2.20/pound dockside. Climate change is a key reason given, but what's going on with shrimp? The price is through the roof.
title: Shrimp prices go big
description: Lobster prices have been shockingly low this summer -- $2.20/pound dockside. Climate change is a key reason given, but what's going on with shrimp? The price is through the roof.
